alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 8:49PM PST until January 12 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations 1 to three inches. Storm total snow amounts between 4 and 9 inches. * WHERE...Gifford, Alpowa Summit, Lewiston, Lapwai, Lewiston Grade, Clarkston, Pomeroy, Culdesac, and Peck. * WHEN...Until 6 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on winter travel conditions with near white out conditions possible through 9 PM. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow bands through 9PM will bring a threat for periods of heavy snow, visibility down to 1/4 mile and wind gusts up to 35 mph. This will lead to white-out conditions at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
